intro: Ostodes angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ostodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to parts of Southeast Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
